definition: this/these/(commonly pr. [zhei4] before a classifier, esp. in Beijing)

sentences.english: At this moment the cannon of the harbor is heard firing, and Suzuki hurries in, saying that it is a warship.
sentences.chinese: 就在這時港口一聲炮響，鈴木跑進來說是一艘軍艦。

sentences.english: At this time, party boat is a sweet promise only to find the police.
sentences.chinese: 這時，方小舟才發現許嫣然是個警察。

sentences.english: The room was then full of people chatting animatedly and laughing .
sentences.chinese: 這時滿屋子的人又說又笑，興高采烈。

sentences.english: At this point of time, Hanwen arrives to arrest Shouye.
sentences.chinese: 這時漢文與偉民前來拘捕守業，衆人喫驚。

sentences.english: He was walking by the sea when he heard a voice for help.
sentences.chinese: 他正在海邊散步，這時突然聽到呼救聲。

sentences.english: And in this case, we have a graph that looks something like this.
sentences.chinese: 這時我們有一個這樣的圖。

sentences.english: The bride was delighted, kissed him, and loved him with all of her heart.
sentences.chinese: 這時新娘非常高興，過來吻他，打心眼裏愛着他。

sentences.english: Now the first bolt of lightning stabs the earth .
sentences.chinese: 這時，第一個雷電劈向大地。

sentences.english: The router's role is then to move traffic between the VLANs.
sentences.chinese: 這時，路由器的作用就是在VLAN之間傳遞流量。

sentences.english: And in spite of its being winter I would perspire all over.
sentences.chinese: 儘管這時還是冬天，我卻渾身都被汗溼透。

sentences.english: At this time, the small grouses drill into the marsh land early in the snow.
sentences.chinese: 這時候，小松雞們早鑽入窪地的積雪裏。

sentences.english: Putin quickly shot the beast and sedated it with a tranquilizer gun.
sentences.chinese: 就在這時，普京迅速拿起一杆麻醉槍將其射倒。

sentences.english: This would be a valid passing opportunity regardless of whether there was pre-existing overlap.
sentences.chinese: 這時後車有權超越，無論有無預先存在“重疊”。

sentences.english: We were on the point of telephoning you when your telegram arrived.
sentences.chinese: 我們正準備給你打電話，這時你的電報來了。

sentences.english: At this point I felt things beginning to skid.
sentences.chinese: 這時，我感到事情有點不妙。
這時，你們應問我“她多大了？”

definition: variant of 這裡|这里[zhe4 li3]
